page.title: 05ECOLOGY IN PAXFORD AREA (1)
page.content: Paxford is situated 110m above sea level surrounded by hills between 160m and 195m high.It lies in an area of Lias(Lower Jurassic)clay.Soil ph7.5 Average annual rainfall>75 cm. Habitats are all semi-natural, i.e.although managed and modified by man contain fairly stable communities of plant and animal life.Roadside verges and hedges provide richest habitats in mainly agricultural area. The extensive area of interconnected and economically unproductive land on roadside verges is the last big nature reseve,and is very sensitive to changes in Highway policy.Verges are managed with considerations toward safety,bank stability,drainage and weed control.More abundant plant growth in 1985 has resulted from later trimming than usual,providing vital cover for small animals and birds.
